definition: hand-to-hand combat
meat/flesh/pulp (of a fruit)/(coll.) (of a fruit) squashy/(of a person) flabby/irresolute/Kangxi radical 130
to fight/to combat/to seize/(of heart) to beat
to fight/fight/war/battle

sentences.english: In hand to hand combat Josh and Quaritch fight to the death.
sentences.chinese: 傑克和誇裏奇以肉搏戰來決戰到死。

sentences.english: Our soldiers bravely fought hand to hand with the enemy.
sentences.chinese: 戰士英勇地同敵人展開肉搏戰。

sentences.english: Wars become depersonalized, and hand-to-hand fighting is replaced by machine warfare.
sentences.chinese: 戰爭變得失去人性，肉搏戰被機械站所代替。

sentences.english: Male are more able to deal with the cut & thrust of business.
sentences.chinese: 男入們更友能立處理生意場丄白勺肉搏戰。

sentences.english: The sword and mace were favourite weapons for hand - to - hand fighting .
sentences.chinese: 劍和狼牙棒是肉搏戰的最佳武器。

sentences.english: These crossbowmen are protected by a shield wall of heavy infantry from melee attacks.
sentences.chinese: 弩兵被手持盾牌的重步兵保護着避免遭遇肉搏戰。

sentences.english: In the hand-to-hand fight, he ran the bayonet through several enemy soldiers.
sentences.chinese: 在肉搏戰中，他用刺刀接連捅死了好幾個敵兵。

sentences.english: Fate specializes in mid-range and melee attacks, preferring speed to power and endurance.
sentences.chinese: 擅長中距離和肉搏戰技能，強調速度勝過力量和耐力。

definition: to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: to open fire/to shoot a gun
lit. to directly attack Huanglong/fig. to directly combat the root of a problem
to attack (one another)
fake move or pass (sports)/feint
to spike the ball (volleyball etc)/to smash (tennis etc)
improvisation
Yellow Pages
to make do in difficult circumstances by being resourceful/(of circumstances) difficult/challenging/(of a budget) tight/(of a man-made thing) makeshift/rough and ready
verbal sparring/duel of words
crafty plots and machinations (idiom)
lit. the river that divides Chu and Han/fig. a line that divides rival territories/the mid-line between sides on a Chinese chessboard
(idiom) due to an unexpected turn of events
to be a cinch/in the bag/(of a person) confident of success
human pyramid
to fire in bursts/shooting intermittently
